intro: Paraphlomis lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spurge, is a perennial herb native to parts of Asia, including China and India. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. It has a fibrous root system and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
